i18n.oblique.file-upload.caption: Drag files or click here to upload
i18n.oblique.file-upload.error.failed: The following files could not be uploaded: {{ ignoredFiles }}
i18n.oblique.file-upload.error.single: Multiple file uploads are not allowed. The following files are ignored: {{ ignoredFiles }}.
i18n.oblique.file-upload.error.size: The maximum file size is {{ maxSize }} MB. The following files are ignored: {{ ignoredFiles }}.
i18n.oblique.file-upload.error.title: Upload error
i18n.oblique.file-upload.error.type: Only the following file formats are supported: {{ supportedTypes }}. The following files are ignored: {{ ignoredFiles }}.
i18n.oblique.file-upload.progressBar.tit: {{ fileCount }} files are currently being uploaded
i18n.oblique.column.left.title: Left column
i18n.oblique.column.right.title: Right column
i18n.oblique.http.error.general: An unknown error has occurred. Please try again later.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.400.title: Bad Request
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.400: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.403.title: Forbidden
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.403: The client does not have access rights to the content. The request is unauthorized because the server is refusing to give the requested resource. Unlike 401, the client's identity is known to the server.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.404.title: Not found
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.404: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future. Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.500.title: Internal server error
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.500: A generic error message, given when an unexpected condition was encountered and no more specific message is suitable.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.501.title: Not Implemented
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.501: The server either does not recognize the request method, or it lacks the ability to fulfil the request. Usually this implies future availability (e.g., a new feature of a web-service API).
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.502.title: Bad gateway
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.502: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.503.title: Service unavailable
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.503: The server cannot handle the request (because it is overloaded or down for maintenance). Generally, this is a temporary state.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.504.title: Gateway timeout
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.504: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and did not receive a timely response from the upstream server.
i18n.oblique.http.error.timeout: The server is taking too long to respond. Please try again later or contact the support.
